title: What am I putting in my mouth?
content:
I am at my advisor’s house for a party and he decided to serve me this “name that font” challenge.

The brand is Loblaws.

My guess is Futura.

I’ll be back after I finish my beverage.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205093253im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Pretzel_5240.jpg)

 [‹ Need help to ID "Fragiles" / Porcelain Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205093253/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42342 "Go to previous forum topic") [Omniterm Data Technology ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205093253/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42378 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Christopher Dean

comments.content: It took me a minute. At first, due to the scale (?) and the apparent **flame-broiled marks** , I thought these were hot dogs. Gross. But they’re pretzels, right? Right? Tell me they’re pretzels!

Yes, they are indeed pretzels.

A little more research leads me to believe they are the same font used in alphabet soup.

Sadly, I do not have access to my food-font database at the moment.
The R is a little off, but [Frankfurter](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205093253/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=frankfurter) would be a good (appropriate?) alternate.

You’ve all seen Robert Bolesta’s [Value Pack](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205093253/http:/www.robertbolesta.com/2005/valuepack.htm), right?

:-)
